Description.div: The root xml element of the header.
Description for the test case that is being trapped.
The name that identifies the group of test cases. GroupId is a mandatory parameter for Trap operation.

Indicates the operations that can be performed. The valid operations are:
Trap: Trap the test case by capturing a screen shot of the user selections.
Execute: Execute the test case identified by theTestKey.
Find: Search for test case(s) by TestId, GroupId or a combination of both TestId and GroupId. All the test cases will be listed, if both TestId and GroupId are not provided.
Rebase: Replace the existing baseline with the current response.
Debug: Execute the test case and return the rule firing trace.
GetXML[Report/Response/Request/Baseline]: Retrieves the Report, Response, Request or Baseline for the test case identified by theTestKey.
The name that identifies the test case. TestId is a mandatory parameter for Trap operation.
Primary key attribute of YIC_CONFIG_REGRESSION_TEST. TestKey is mandatory for all operations, except Trap.
The root xml element of the header.
An identifier of the customer. This is a pass through field available to user exits.

Date on which the configuration picks are processed. This date is used for all time sensitive information associated with the configuration, like pricing, entitlements, rule and constraint evaluations. If void it is defaulted to current date and time.

The country identifier for the models.
Country is not passed.
Country is not valid.

Currency used for pricing data selection.
Currency is not passed.
Currency is not valid.

The identifier for the customer.
If not void then CustomerID must be of one of the valid customer.

The depth of items within the model that should be retrieved. If attribute is not set or is -1 , the entire depth of the model will be returned. Otherwise, the attribute should be an integer number > 0 that specifies how deep the traversal should continue.
Depth is invalid.
The EnterpriseCode on which behalf pricing inquiry is being made. If not passed OrganizationCode primary enterprise will be used.
Firing Phase
If IgnoreCustomerEntitlements is passed as Y then the customer entitlements are not applied. Default value is N .

The language identifier for the models to search for.
Language is not passed.
Language is not valid.

The depth of the current model with respect to the root model. The ModelDepth attribute must be set for child models. Default value is 0 .
ModelDepth is invalid.

Pricing data is read on behalf of the organization specified by OrganizationCode.
OrganizationCode is not passed.
OrganizationCode is not valid.

The path to the model that should be retrieved.
Path is not passed.
Path is not valid.
The item to resolve.
The variant attribute denotes the variant (dialect) of the Language input

div.p:
Used to include the elements that are returned from the API. The API includes an element if:
The element matches the one of the inclusion specifiers OR no include filters are specified
AND
The element doesn't match any of the exclusion specifiers OR no exclude filters are specified

Description.div:
The class of item this inclusion specifier operates on.
Valid Values: Item or Optionclass or Optionitem or Property or Tab or Messages or Summary or TraceLog or PropertyPool
Item can be specified to include both Optionclass and Optionitem.
Class is not passed or is void.
A regular expression that is matched against the name of the item, property name, or tab name.
A regular expression that is matched against the path of an item. Not valid for tab class.
This attribute is only valid for the property class. This attribute should contain the datatype name of the properties that need to match.

div.p:
Used to filter the elements that are returned from the API. The API filters an element if:
The element doesn't match any of the inclusion specifiers
OR
The element matches one of the exclusion specifiers
The API doesn't filter Optionclass and Optionitem elements if it has child elements.
For eg. To filter Optionitem element(s) which has a set of properties associated to it, both Optionitem and Property has to be excluded by specifying exclude filters in the following manner:
<Exclude Class="Optionitem"/>
<Exclude Class="Property"/>

The class of item this exclusion specifier operates on.
Valid Values: Item or Optionclass or Optionitem or Property or Tab or Messages or Summary or TraceLog or PropertyPool
Item can be specified to exclude both Optionclass and Optionitem.

Validation.Condition: Class is not passed or is void.

Error.Description: Mandatory Parameters for the Operation are missing.

Description.div: A regular expression that is matched against the name of the item, property name, or tab name.
A regular expression that is matched against the path of an item. Not valid for tab class.
This attribute is only valid for the property class. This attribute should contain the datatype name of the properties that need to match.
The Picks element from the output of previous API call should be included in the input for subsequent API call.
A pick node contains the internal information about a pick.
The configurator item name for a pick.

The id of the configurator item. This is applicable only for option items created dynamically through instantiateSubModel API. This value is initially captured while creating child model instances using instantiateSubModel API.
The quantity of the pick.

The type of action to be performed on the pick. Default value is add. For option items created dynamically through instantiateSubModel API, the type should be specified as create. This value is initially captured while creating child model instances using instantiateSubModel API.
The user entered value associated with the item.

The configuration of the entire sub-model tree associated with the option item. The nested configuration includes all the configuration information from the descendants. This information is initially captured while returning from the sub-model.
This element has the header information of configurator BOM.

The full configurator name for the model.
ModelName is not passed.
The current BOM version.

This attribute is true if the model root has the container only flag set otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false

This attribute is true if there are errors in the BOM, otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
BOMs can contain messages about the status of the configuration and are produced by rules or constraint tables.
Name of the message.

The type of the message in the configurator BOM.
Valid Values: error or warning or suggest
The displayable value for the message.
LineItems form a tree structure in that they can contain other line items. The top most LineItem is the root of the model.
An optional key for the item from an order. These keys are preserved if it is passed in the input. It will be returned in the output.
The description of the LineItem.
The item configurator ID for the item.
The visual modeler key for the item. This attribute is not considered in the input.
The unique name for the LineItem in a particular depth of the hierarchy.
The price of the LineItem.
The quantity of the item ordered for the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the item was picked by a rule otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The sku associated to the LineItem.
The UOM associated to the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the item should be visible to the user in the order, otherwise false. Very often models contain information needed for reconfiguration that should not be visible in the order.
Valid Values: true or false

This attribute is true if the price in the BOM should used in the order, otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The user entered value associated to the LineItem.

The holder of properties associated with the LineItem. It contains:
The Configurator Properties that are attached to the items in the model and flagged as "output" properties.
The external input properties injected into the model to influence its runtime behavior.
The flag to differentiate externally injected input properties from output properties. The attribute value is Y , if the property is an externally injected input property. Default value is N .
Name of the property.

The type of the property in the configurator BOM.
Valid Values: bigdecimal or int or List or long or double or String or date or unknown
The value of the property in string form.
LineItems form a tree structure in that they can contain other line items. The top most LineItem is the root of the model.
An optional key for the item from an order. These keys are preserved if it is passed in the input. It will be returned in the output.
The description of the LineItem.
The item configurator ID for the item.
The visual modeler key for the item. This attribute is not considered in the input.
The unique name for the LineItem in a particular depth of the hierarchy.
The price of the LineItem.
The quantity of the item ordered for the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the item was picked by a rule otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The sku associated to the LineItem.
The UOM associated to the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the item should be visible to the user in the order, otherwise false. Very often models contain information needed for reconfiguration that should not be visible in the order.
Valid Values: true or false

This attribute is true if the price in the BOM should used in the order, otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The user entered value associated to the LineItem.
The holder of additional line prices associated with the LineItem. It contains one or more AdditionalLinePrice elements.
Contains the details of an additional line price type that is associated to the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the price type value in the BOM should used in the order, otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The price value of the price type.
The name of the price type
The output properties from the sub-model and its descendants associated with the option item. This information is initially captured while returning from the sub-model.
The holder of output properties.
This element holds information about properties associated to item.
The name of the property.
The path to the item that contains the property.

The datatype of the property.
Valid Values: bigdecimal or int or List or long or double or String or date or unknown
The value in string form for the property. List values are returned with each value separated by a carriage return.
This dom node is used to add a pick to the picks dom node.
The full configurator path name of the item being added.
The quantity of the pick. It is defaulted to 1 if this attribute is not passed.
The user entered value associated with the item.
This dom node is used to remove a pick from the picks dom node.
A regular expression used to match items that should be removed.

div.p: The configuration of parent model(s) in the configuration path. The parent configuration at each level is captured separately under <ParentConfiguration> element. This information is initially captured while punching into the sub-model from the parent model. This configuration is applicable only for sub-models.
The ParentConfigurations should be resent by the caller as-is without modification.

Description.div: The node contains the configuration details of a parent model. It also captures input properties for the model in this configuration.
The depth of the model with respect to the root model.
The path of the option item on which the punch was invoked. On return from sub model, the child configuration will be attached to this item.
The SubModelReturn flag indicates whether end-users return from sub model to the model in this configuration.
The SubModelValidate flag indicating whether the child configuration is validated on return from sub model.

div.p: A holder of input properties applicable for this particular parent configuration. It contains the properties derived from its parent state in the preceding <ParentConfiguration>, based on the input property list defined in the model in this configuration and/or external properties to this configuration when it was configured.
External properties should not be injected directly in the parent configuration.

Description.div: This element holds information about input properties for the model in this configuration.
The name of the property in the property pool.
The path to a property from the property pool.
The datatype of the property.
The value of the property.
This element has the header information of configurator BOM.

The full configurator name for the model.
ModelName is not passed.
The current BOM version.

This attribute is true if the model root has the container only flag set otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false

This attribute is true if there are errors in the BOM, otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
BOMs can contain messages about the status of the configuration and are produced by rules or constraint tables.
Name of the message.

The type of the message in the configurator BOM.
Valid Values: error or warning or suggest
The displayable value for the message.
LineItems form a tree structure in that they can contain other line items. The top most LineItem is the root of the model.
An optional key for the item from an order. These keys are preserved if it is passed in the input. It will be returned in the output.
The description of the LineItem.
The item configurator ID for the item.
The visual modeler key for the item. This attribute is not considered in the input.
The unique name for the LineItem in a particular depth of the hierarchy.
The price of the LineItem.
The quantity of the item ordered for the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the item was picked by a rule otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The sku associated to the LineItem.
The UOM associated to the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the item should be visible to the user in the order, otherwise false. Very often models contain information needed for reconfiguration that should not be visible in the order.
Valid Values: true or false

This attribute is true if the price in the BOM should used in the order, otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The user entered value associated to the LineItem.

The holder of properties associated with the LineItem. It contains:
The Configurator Properties that are attached to the items in the model and flagged as "output" properties.
The external input properties injected into the model to influence its runtime behavior.
The flag to differentiate externally injected input properties from output properties. The attribute value is Y , if the property is an externally injected input property. Default value is N .
Name of the property.

The type of the property in the configurator BOM.
Valid Values: bigdecimal or int or List or long or double or String or date or unknown
The value of the property in string form.
LineItems form a tree structure in that they can contain other line items. The top most LineItem is the root of the model.
An optional key for the item from an order. These keys are preserved if it is passed in the input. It will be returned in the output.
The description of the LineItem.
The item configurator ID for the item.
The visual modeler key for the item. This attribute is not considered in the input.
The unique name for the LineItem in a particular depth of the hierarchy.
The price of the LineItem.
The quantity of the item ordered for the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the item was picked by a rule otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The sku associated to the LineItem.
The UOM associated to the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the item should be visible to the user in the order, otherwise false. Very often models contain information needed for reconfiguration that should not be visible in the order.
Valid Values: true or false

This attribute is true if the price in the BOM should used in the order, otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The user entered value associated to the LineItem.
The holder of additional line prices associated with the LineItem. It contains one or more AdditionalLinePrice elements.
Contains the details of an additional line price type that is associated to the LineItem.

This attribute is true if the price type value in the BOM should used in the order, otherwise false.
Valid Values: true or false
The price value of the price type.
The name of the price type

A holder of input properties applicable for the current model. It contains:
External properties to be injected into the current model.
Properties derived from parent state, based on the input property list defined in the current model. This information is initially captured while punching into the current model from its parent.
These input property values are considered while evaluating the rules in the current model. The InputProperties element from the output of previous API call should be included in the input for subsequent API call.
This element holds information about input properties for the current model.

The flag to indicate whether the property is an external input property or not. If External is passed as Y , the property is injected into the model and also captured in the BOM under the corresponding LineItem. Default value is N .
The name of the property in the property pool. Name is mandatory, if the property is an external input property.
The path to a property from the property pool. Path is mandatory, if the property is an external input property.

The datatype of the property. Valid values: String or Double or Integer or List or Date. Type is mandatory, if the property is an external input property.
Type is not valid.
The value of the property.
